question: Why is a runners heart rate lower than a non runner
answers: A runner's heart rate is lower than a non runner's because of the physical changes that occur from regular endurance training.
As the body adapts to the exercise, the vagal tone increases, suppressing the heart rate.
Training also increases the heart's size, so it can push out a larger volume of blood with each contraction.
This means that a lower heart rate can deliver the same blood volume as a higher heart rate in an untrained heart.
In addition, regular exercise conditions the heart to beat more slowly during periods of rest, making it less susceptible to disease.
Exercise also increases the heart muscle mass, so it takes less effort for the heart to pump blood efficiently.
As a result, the runner's heart requires fewer beats per minute to keep the blood circulating.
Therefore, a runner's heart rate is lower than a non runner's due to the physical changes that have occurred from regular exercise.

question: Why are there only circular planets? Why can't there be square or rectangular ones?
answers: The gravitational force of a planet causes all the material surrounding it to gather around a central point, creating a spherical shape.
This is why planets are round and why they remain that way, even after they have cooled down and become solid.
The only way for all the mass of a planet to be evenly distributed and as close to the planet's center of gravity as possible is to form a sphere.
Since the gravitational force of a planet is not strong enough to push the material into specific shapes, such as a square or rectangle, it is not possible for planets to take on those shapes.
Additionally, since planets spin, the faster they spin, the bigger the bulges in their round shapes.
This means that even if planets could be a different shape, any shape other than a sphere would be distorted due to the planet's spin.

In comparison, small asteroids do not have a strong enough gravity to pull all the material around them into a sphere, so they are generally not round and are often jagged, fragmented, and irregular in shape.
This explains why planets are round and why they cannot take on other shapes.

question: Why do french fries taste awful if reheated, but something like pizza is comparable whether fresh or reheated?
answers: French fries taste awful when reheated because of a variety of factors.
Firstly, they are usually fried in vegetable oil, which has a boiling point of around 320 degrees, much higher than water.
When microwaved, the fries overcook while the oil, which is often dank and gross from other items fried in the same fryer, soaks into the fry, ruining the flavor.
Additionally, when heated in the microwave, the water molecules and other components such as proteins get damaged which can change the taste of the food, leading to a loss of flavor.
Temperature also plays a role, as heat can heighten the flavors in food, and when fries cool down they lose their original flavor.
Finally, smell plays a big role in how a food tastes; when fries are cold, their aroma is largely gone and without this smell, a lot of the flavor disappears.

Pizza, on the other hand, is comparable whether fresh or reheated because the ingredients used in pizza are typically more robust and resistant to changes in temperature, meaning the flavor and texture remain the same when reheated.

question: Why do some liquids form skins on them but others don't?
answers: The formation of a skin or film on a liquid is largely determined by the proteins and fats present in the liquid.
When heated, proteins and fats become more concentrated on the surface of the liquid, which causes them to bind together and form a protective skin.
This skin is often caused by the rapid heating of liquids, such as when boiling milk on a stovetop.
However, not all liquids contain proteins or fats, so they will not form a skin when heated.
For example, water does not contain proteins or fats and therefore does not form a skin when it is heated.
Furthermore, even if a liquid does contain proteins and fats, the temperature at which it is heated must be high enough to cause the proteins and fats to coagulate, otherwise a skin will not form.

In addition, some liquids, such as soy milk, will form a skin even though they are marketed as fat-free, because they still contain trace amounts of fats which can be drawn to the surface when exposed to very high temperatures.

question: what causes the center of ice to whiten?
answers: The center of ice cubes whiten due to the freezing process, which pushes small amounts of suspended minerals and sediment, as well as tiny trapped air bubbles, to the center.

As the water freezes, it wants to form a regular crystalline structure (ice), which means impurities like oxygen and other dissolved gasses are pushed away from the crystallization front into the remaining liquid.
This means that the last parts of the ice cube to crystallize end up with most of the impurities, resulting in a harmless (but not particularly photogenic) ice cube clouding.
Additionally, the oxygen in the water is pushed away from the crystallization front and trapped at the bottom, forming a pool of debris that causes a cloudy center.
This is known as directional freezing, which offers the chance at the clearest ice cubes.

question: If I were to create a company, have $1M debt, go bankrupt, how would the company that I owe get its money ? do I have to pay ?
answers: If a company that you owe goes bankrupt, then the creditors will be paid in a certain order of priority.
If the company has $1M debt, the secured creditors will be paid first.
These are debts like the mortgage on company buildings, leases on company cars and loans for unpaid pieces of equipment.
Secured creditors get their money back first, usually by taking back their property.
If this isn't enough to pay off the debt, the secured creditors get first dibs on any remaining company money.
After secured creditors are paid, unsecured creditors are then paid.
These debts not based on a physical piece of property.
Unsecured debts could be credit card bills, unpaid insurance premiums and bank loans that weren't backed up by property.
It also includes payments to bondholders.
Unsecured creditors charge higher interest than secured creditors because of this higher bankruptcy risk.
Lastly, shareholders are last in line during the bankruptcy process.
When a company declares bankruptcy, its stock becomes worthless.
The shareholders only get money after all other debts are paid.
Since the company was in bad enough shape to declare bankruptcy, this isn't especially likely.
Shareholders should only expect to get a fraction of their investment returned after bankruptcy and shouldn't be surprised to get nothing at all.
In summary, if a company you owe goes bankrupt, then the creditors will be paid in a certain order of priority.
Secured creditors will be paid first, followed by unsecured creditors, and then shareholders.
You may have to pay some of the debt depending on how much money is left over after the creditors have been paid.

question: Why do we use air filled tires and not tires made of solid rubber, that don't run the risk of going flat?
answers: Air filled tires are preferable to tires made of solid rubber because they offer greater energy efficiency, provide a smoother ride, and are better able to absorb the shock of striking obstacles on the road.
This is because air is compressible, meaning it can adjust its volume in response to the pressure of the car, and can absorb the shock of striking small obstacles.
This ability of air to compress and absorb shock makes for a much smoother and more comfortable ride, as well as reducing the amount of energy lost due to rolling resistance.
In addition, air filled tires are much lighter than solid rubber tires, meaning they require less fuel expenditure, and wear down at a slower rate, meaning they require less frequent replacement.

question: Why do VGA/DVI cables have to be screwed in, but HDMI and other cables don't?
answers: The primary reason why VGA/DVI cables have to be screwed in is to prevent accidental disconnection.
Unlike USB connectors, these types of cables lack the physical holding pressure, and so the screws help to keep them securely in place.
This design was made with the intention of making sure the cables stay in place, as it is unlikely that they will be unplugged frequently.
Additionally, the screws also help to protect against the cable being accidentally tugged and causing the monitor to crash to the floor.
On the other hand, HDMI and other cables don't have to be screwed in.
This is because the design allows for hot-plugging, which makes it easier for users to quickly plug in and out.

Furthermore, there are also practical reasons why HDMI cables don't come with screws, such as the difficulty in finding the right screw and thread size, as well as the increased cost of communication with the manufacturer.

question: Why do different European languages have such varying names for Germany?
answers: Different European languages have varying names for Germany due to the global game of cultural “telephone” that has been played for thousands of years.
As explorers traversed the globe and discovered new places, they often had no idea what to call them, so they asked the locals and the names got passed along on trade routes or through diplomacy.

As a result, the names were spoken and heard by people who didn’t share the same language, and somewhere along the way, a name got garbled or misunderstood or even purposefully changed to accommodate the sounds of one language or another.

In the case of Germany, the root of the name is from the Gauls, who called the tribe across the river the Germani, which might have meant “neighbor” or “men of the forest.” English borrowed the name in turn and anglicized the ending to get Germany.
Meanwhile, the Alemanni, a southern Germanic tribe that lived around modern-day Switzerland and Alsace prompted the French and Spanish to name the land Allemagne and Alemanía, respectively.
The Turkish name for Greece, Yunanistan, similarly derives from the Ionians, the Greek tribe that established settlements in Asia Minor and had early contact.
Therefore, the varying names for Germany in European languages is simply a result of the cultural “telephone” game played for thousands of years.

question: Why oil and gas rigs may cause earthquake and falls?
answers: Oil and gas rigs may cause earthquakes and falls due to rapid injection of fluid during wastewater disposal.
This process can pump hundreds of millions of gallons of brine deep into the earth each year and fill up crevices in the rock previously occupied by oil, creating an overpressure on the fault.
This can reduce the stress that's pinning the fault into place, causing the fault to jump and trigger earthquakes.
Falls can also occur due to the pressure of the injected fluids destabilizing the ground near the rigs, leading to a shift in the surface.

question: Why am I unstable on my bike when it's stationary but not when it's moving?
answers: When a bike is stationary, it has no angular momentum, meaning that any external force can easily cause the bike to tip to one side or the other, making it difficult to balance.
However, when a bike is moving, the wheels have their own angular momentum vectors, which resist tipping from side to side, like a gyroscope.

Furthermore, since the bike is moving, any tipping to one side or the other can be corrected by turning the front wheel slightly to one side and getting a mv^2/r force that will tend to counteract the tipping.
This force gets larger as the bike's velocity increases, making it easier for the rider to orient their center of mass in line with the bike's frame and stay balanced.
Moreover, the spinning wheels of moving bicycles remain pointed in the same direction if there are no external torques, making it easier for the rider to keep the bike balanced.
Thus, the combination of angular momentum and corrective forces from the front wheel make it much easier to balance a bike when it is in motion than when it is stationary.

question: Why do fish that live around coral reefs appear to be more colorful than fish that don't live around coral reefs?
answers: Fish that live around coral reefs have evolved to display more vivid and varied coloration than those living in other environments due to a variety of reasons.
First, the vibrant colors serve as a visual protection from predators.
By blending in with their environment or displaying bright colors, fish can be less easily spotted by predators.
Second, the bright colors also serve as a way for fish to identify each other in the crowded reef environment.
Through their unique color patterns, individual fish can identify their own species and even recognize potential competitors within the same breed.
Third, the fact that fish live underwater rather than on land is also a factor.
Because light is refracted and distorted underwater, fish have adapted to display intricate color patterns so they can be more easily identified in their environment.
Finally, the fact that humans can’t tell what fish see means that they may be displaying colors that humans don’t understand.
Fish may have their own methods of identifying each other that they use to determine who they are interacting with.
In conclusion, there are many reasons why fish that live around coral reefs appear to be more colorful than fish that don’t live around coral reefs.
From visual protection to individual recognition, the vibrant colors serve a variety of purposes for the fish living in this unique habitat.

question: Birds in the Northern Hemisphere migrate south for the winter. Are there birds from the Southern Hemisphere that migrate north for the summer? What species are they?
answers: Yes, there are birds in the Southern Hemisphere that migrate north for the summer.
The most famous among these species are the Pacific Ocean populations of Sooty and Short-tailed Shearwaters.
These seabirds breed around Australia and New Zealand, arriving at their breeding colonies in October, laying eggs in November, and fledging chicks by late April.
They then journey north, arriving in Japan, Alaska, and California by May and June.

Other species include the carmine bee-eater which migrates from South Africa in March and heads for east Africa, as well as Wilson's Petrel and Great Shearwater which breed in the Southern Hemisphere and migrate north in the southern winter.
These birds are taking advantage of the more abundant food and warmer weather in the Northern Hemisphere.

question: Why does it feel like less effort to watch 3 - hour long TV episodes back to back than a film?

question: Why does the President of the United States need to be born in the United States to be eligible to run?
answers: The framers of the U.S. Constitution wanted to ensure that the nation’s highest office was not subject to foreign influence or the machinations of European royal families.
By requiring that the president be a natural-born citizen, they sought to ensure that the highest office in the land was not subject to foreign influence.
This requirement was also meant to prevent a European noble from using their money and influence to sway the Electoral College and return the United States to a royalist fold.

Furthermore, the framers were aware of the tragic example of Poland, where agents from Russia, Prussia, and Austria conspired to install a friendly monarch, Stanislaus II, and subsequently seized upon his weakness and partitioned the country among themselves.
As a result, they wanted to ensure that the president was not subject to dynastic ambitions or the machinations of foreign powers.
By requiring that the president be a natural-born citizen, the framers sought to ensure that the president was only subject to the authority of the U.S. government.

question: Why do some planets form rings while others form moons?
answers: The formation of moons and rings around planets is likely related to the gravitational pull of the planet, the nature of the material in its orbit, and the presence of other moons.

One theory suggests that the rings of some planets, such as the gas giants in the outer Solar System, form due to the gravitational pull of the planet being too strong for material close to it to coalesce into a moon.
Instead, the material is pulled into a ring around the planet.
Another idea is that a close pass by a moon or comet can break it up, and the debris can form a ring system.

Additionally, it is thought that the expelled light gases from the inner regions of the Solar System made it easier for the outer planets to form moons and retain their rings, due to the larger gravitational forces, the presence of volatile ices, and the shepherding of material by numerous moons.
All of these factors likely contribute to the formation of rings around some planets, while others form moons.

question: Why do solar systems look mostly 'flat'?
answers: Solar systems look mostly flat because of the law of conservation of angular momentum.
This law states that in an isolated system, the total angular momentum must remain constant.
This means that particles that experience collisions can move in any direction, but all the up and down motion cancels out.
Over time, these particles lose their freedom to move in all directions, except for a select 2-dimensional plane.
This is why solar systems look mostly flat.
The formation of the solar system gives us a great example of this principle in action.
When a huge blob of gas and dust floated millions of miles across space, they were drawn together by gravity.
As the particles collided, their new trajectories were random, but their angular momentum had to remain constant.
Over time, all the up and down motion cancelled out, leaving the particles in a select 2-dimensional plane.
This is why all the planets in our solar system are in the same plane, and why solar systems look mostly flat.

question: If you put glasses from someone with dioptry, do you see like they see without them?
answers: No, you do not see like the person with the glasses does without them.
Diopter strength refers to the optical power of a lens, which is measured by the focal length of the lens.
Lenses with a focal length of 1 meter have a diopter strength of 1.

When you put on someone else's glasses, the optical power of the lens is different than the diopter strength that is suited to your vision, which causes an out-of-focus image to be presented to your retina.
This is much like a distorted image in an amusement park mirror.
In adults, putting on someone else’s glasses won’t damage your eyesight, but it can cause discomfort.
However, kids are at a higher risk of harming their eyes if they wear the wrong prescription, as their vision is still developing until the ages of 7 to 9.

Therefore, it is important to make sure you are wearing the correct prescription glasses for your eyesight, as wearing glasses from someone with a different diopter strength can cause vision problems.

question: FB posts baiting people to "share if you see x" or "Little Timmy has Cancer and will live with 1M Likes" or the easy puzzles designed to stroke your ego and post the answer. Does anyone make money from this?
answers: Yes, scammers do make money from like-farming posts on Facebook.
Like-farming posts are designed to get many likes and shares, often using emotional messages to encourage people to click, like, and share.
Scammers can then use the post to steal personal information from those who register, or to add malicious links to the post, or to promote spammy products.
They may also sell the page on the black market to others who use it to spam followers or to harvest information from Facebook.
In December 2017, Facebook announced that it was stamping out such posts, which it calls “engagement bait”, as it believes they are gaming the system.
Examples of this type of like-farming include posts that ask you to share a post to win a prize, or posts offering unrealistically high value prizes for simple interactions.
In all of these cases, scammers are able to generate profits from manipulating users into clicking on their posts.

question: Why is automatic transmission fluid so unique? Does the viscosity of ATF change the more it moves?
answers: Automatic transmission fluid is unique because it has to provide precise frictional properties that differ from manual transmission fluid in order to ensure that the gears engage and disengage seamlessly and provide the driver with the best driving experience.

This is accomplished by a complex series of passages in the valve body that directs fluid to engage the correct gear when the vehicle’s computer sends an electric signal to the appropriate transmission solenoid.
The fluid must have the right viscosity to flow quickly for crisp shifts, which is why automatic transmission fluid has a lower viscosity than manual transmission fluid.
The viscosity of ATF does not change the more it moves, but it is formulated with long-chain hydrocarbons that have a polar group on one end, which provides the desired amount of friction.
The various types of ATF differ in the fluid’s friction characteristics.

question: How has technological growth increased so exponentially in the last 50 years?
answers: Technological growth has increased exponentially in the last 50 years due to the law of accelerating returns and the positive feedback loop of improvements that happen when each new generation of technology builds on the advances of its predecessors.

question: what is 'Magnetic moment'
answers: Magnetic moment, also known as magnetic dipole moment, is the measure of the object’s tendency to align with a magnetic field.
It is a vector quantity, and is defined as magnetic strength and orientation of a magnet or other object that produces a magnetic field.
The direction of the magnetic moment points from the south to the north pole of a magnet.
The magnetic field created by a magnet is directly proportional to the magnetic moment.
The objects have a tendency to place themselves in such a way that the magnetic moment vector becomes parallel to the magnetic field lines.
The dipole component of an object's magnetic field is symmetric about the direction of its magnetic dipole moment, and decreases as the inverse cube of the distance from the object.
The strength (and direction) of the torque created by the magnetic field depends on the magnitude and orientation of the magnetic moment.
Therefore, the magnetic moment can be considered a vector that points from the south to north pole of the magnet (inside the magnet).

question: What is the difference between sigma bonds and pi bonds?
answers: Sigma bonds are the strongest type of covalent chemical bond, formed by head-on overlapping between atomic orbitals.

They are symmetrical with respect to rotation about the bond axis, whereas pi bonds are formed by sidewise positive (same phase) overlap of atomic orbitals along a direction perpendicular to the internuclear axis.

Pi bonds are generally weaker than sigma bonds due to the significantly lower degree of overlapping, and free rotation of atoms around the sigma bonds is possible, whereas free rotation of atoms around pi bonds is not possible because it involves breaking the pi bonds.
Furthermore, a pi bond between two atoms is formed only in addition to a sigma bond, as atoms constituting a single bond prefer to form a strong sigma bond rather than a weak pi bond.
Thus, a pi bond is always present in molecules with multiple bonds, such as double or triple bonds.

question: Do people who hear for the first time, after something like getting hearing implants, know what the other people are saying?

question: What is austerity?
answers: Austerity is a set of political-economic policies implemented by governments in order to reduce government budget deficits.
The measures are typically used when a government finds it difficult to borrow or meet its existing obligations to pay back loans.
Austerity measures typically involve raising taxes to fund spending, raising taxes while cutting spending, or lower taxes and lower government spending.
The goal of austerity is to reduce the budget deficit by bringing government revenues closer to expenditures.
This reduces the amount of borrowing required and may also demonstrate a government's fiscal discipline to creditors and credit rating agencies, making borrowing easier and cheaper.

While some economists argue that austerity is necessary to reduce budget deficits and improve long-term economic performance, Keynesian economists argue that it can be ‘self-defeating’ with spending cuts causing a fall in aggregate demand, leading to lower economic growth.

answers: Proponents of relaxed immigration argue that undocumented immigrants do not drive down wages in the US.

This is supported by research from the Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta which found that documented workers at firms that employ undocumented workers actually earn 0.15% more on average than those who do not.

Additionally, research from the Migration Advisory Committee found that EU and non-EU immigration had no significant statistical impact on UK-born employment during either 1975-1994 or during 1995-2010.
This is likely due to the fact that the size of the labor supply shift is matched by the amount of new jobs created, meaning there is no displacement effect.
However, in Mexico, the situation is different.
The influx of undocumented immigrants returning to Mexico has resulted in a decrease in wages for low-wage workers.
This is due to the fact that the economy of Mexico is not as developed as that of the US and labor market regulations are not as strict.
This makes it easier for employers to pay lower wages and makes it more difficult for workers to organize or bargain for better wages.

Thus, the influx of undocumented immigrants to Mexico has caused a decrease in wages for low-wage workers, while proponents of relaxed immigration argue that they do not have the same effect in the US.

question: Explain: The security implications Microsoft's "golden key" backdoor, present in all copies of Windows since Windows 8.

question: Why does it seem like when I watch something the second time around, it goes by faster than the first time I watched it?
answers: It seems that when we watch something the second time around, it goes by faster than the first time because our brains are able to make more efficient use of the information.
When we watch something for the first time, we have to process all of the new information and our brains are focused on understanding the content of what we are watching.
However, when we watch something for the second time, our brains have had a chance to process the information and are able to make more efficient use of the information.
This means that our brains can focus more on the passage of time and as a result, it feels like the passage of time goes by faster.

This phenomenon is supported by research conducted by Dinah Avni-Babad and Ilana Ritov in the Journal of Experimental Psychology: General, which found that people judge the duration of a period of time from memory differently than they judge the duration of a time period as it is going on.
They concluded that the busier you are during a time interval, the faster that time interval will feel like it passed.
This is likely because when you are cognitively busy, you are focused on each task you are performing and don't have the opportunity to notice the passage of time, so it feels like it passes quickly.
Moreover, there is research that suggests that chemicals in the brain can also impact how the brain perceives time.

When you're having fun, the neurons that release dopamine, an important chemical involved in feeling rewarded, are more active and release more dopamine, so your brain judges that less time has passed.
Therefore, when you watch something for the second time, it is likely that you are more familiar with the content and more able to focus on enjoying it, so the time passes more quickly.

question: How can a vehicle's air filter effect its gas mileage?
answers: A dirty air filter can have a significant negative effect on a vehicle's gas mileage.
As the air filter becomes clogged with dirt and debris, the engine will be unable to take in enough air to maintain its regular performance.
This will cause the computer to compensate by allowing the engine to use more fuel in the air-fuel mixture, in order to produce enough power to propel the vehicle forward.
As a result, the vehicle will consume more fuel and require more trips to the gas station, drastically reducing the fuel efficiency of the engine.
Additionally, the excess fuel will cause the vehicle to produce more black smoke and soot, resulting in even more wasted fuel.
To ensure optimal fuel efficiency, it is important to regularly inspect and maintain the air filter, replacing it when necessary.

question: How did people manipulate photographs before computers?
answers: Before computers, people manipulated photographs primarily by combining printing, exposure variations, photomontage techniques, and alterations on the negative.

This was done on a special table with a variable inclination angle of the working surface, where the negative was placed on a special frame and shone through from behind using an adjustable mirror or other reflective surface, with curtains on top and sides to avoid stray light.

People would also use darkroom exposure techniques, such as burning (darkening) and dodging (lightening), as well as retouching photographs using ink or paint, airbrushing, double exposure, piecing photos or negatives together in the darkroom, scratching instant films, and other methods.
Ansel Adams was one of the first photographers to employ these techniques in order to improve the photos.
With all of these methods, people wanted to see the missing or even deceased relatives in their shots, do artistic experiments, and express political satire with their help.

question: Why does lying down reduce my urge to puke when I feel like puking?
answers: Lying down with your head elevated about 12 inches above your feet can help reduce the urge to vomit when you feel nauseous.
This is because lying down helps to keep stomach acids down, which can relieve symptoms of gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).

question: Why do people in all old voice recordings have the same "old timey" accents?
answers: The primary reason why people in all old voice recordings have the same "old timey" accent is due to primitive microphone technology.
Receivers had very little bass technology at the time, making it very difficult - if not impossible - to hear bass tones on home devices.

Therefore, people were instructed to and learned to speak in a nasally, clipped pronunciation so that their words could be best transmitted through the microphone to the radio waves or to recording media.

This nasally, clipped pronunciation then became a vestige from the early days of radio and eventually the "hallmark of aristocratic America," acquired usually in New England boarding schools as an international norm for communication.
However, this speech fell out of favor after World War II as fewer teachers continued teaching the pronunciation to their students.
This is why the speech sounds so "old-timey" to us today, as when people learn it, they're usually learning it for acting purposes, rather than for everyday use.
Nevertheless, we can still hear its effects in recordings of everyone from Katherine Hepburn to Franklin D. Roosevelt and countless films, newsreels, and radio shows from the 30s and 40s.

question: Why will a file load to 99% with no problem then hang for what seems like forever?
answers: A file will load to 99% with no problem then hang for what seems like forever due to a number of reasons.

Firstly, the progress bar at the top of the open WebDav window on the client is misleading, in that it zooms across rapidly while copying outgoing files into a local cache on the client, then, as the bar sets near the end, it actually performs the transfer.
Secondly, the file is copied into a buffer and when the file is completely in the buffer, it displays 99.9%, but it's still being written to the USD flash drive which is slow.
If the buffer and the file are huge, then it stays at 99.9% for a long time.
Thirdly, Windows write to disk by caching the writes to the disk, which could be causing the problem.
Fourthly, antivirus software, file caching, out of memory, and computer performance may also contribute to the issue.

question: The Lean Six Sigma Methodology
answers: The Lean Six Sigma methodology is a fact-based, data-driven philosophy of improvement that focuses on reducing process variation and enhancing process control to achieve operational performance goals and continuously improve.
It is a comprehensive set of tools, analytical techniques, and processes that are used to identify and solve problems, reduce waste, and create a competitive advantage.
The objective is to reduce the variation in output and reduce errors through the implementation of a measurement-based strategy.

By tracking and analyzing data, and using statistical modeling, changes to an existing process are identified that will result in improved output, such as reduced defects, increased throughput, and more efficient processes.
Lean Six Sigma is an effective way to improve processes and reduce costs, and every employee should be involved in its implementation.

question: What causes us to tear up when we cut onions? Is there a way to prevent this?
answers: When we cut into an onion, the cells inside the onion are broken up, releasing an enzyme called allinase.
This enzyme produces chemicals that are subsequently broken down into flavor molecules, and some of the chemicals involved in this reaction are turned into lachrymatory factor (LF) by LF synthase.

LF is a chemical that causes our eyes to well up when it comes into contact with the front of the eye, or the cornea, triggering nerve endings and signaling to the brain that an irritant has arrived on the scene.
This, in turn, leads to signaling back from the brain to the tear glands, resulting in the stinging sensation and welling up of tears that comes from chopping onions.
The reason onions make us cry can be traced back to the soil.
Onions are part of the “Genus Allium” plant family, and they absorb sulfur from the soil.
When we cut into an onion, we break its cells, releasing the contents inside which allows chemicals that were previously separated by a cell membrane to combine with each other and with the air.
This reaction produces a volatile sulfur gas which wafts up from the onion and reacts with the natural water in your eye to form sulfuric acid.
The only way to prevent this reaction from taking place is to avoid cutting into onions.
If this is not possible, there are a few things you can do to reduce the amount of tears you shed when chopping onions.
You can wear protective eye gear, such as goggles, or try cutting onions under water.
Alternatively, you could try chilling the onion in the refrigerator for a few minutes before cutting, which will reduce the amount of LF released.

question: Explain: Having a "stone" in your saliva gland.

question: Why does smoking tobacco cause cancer, but smoking marijuana does not?
answers: Smoking tobacco and marijuana both contain many of the same carcinogens and tumor promoters, such as polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons.

question: How can water boil below 100°C?

question: All these stories about the "fake snow" being passed around within the past week or so... what is REALLY going on here?
answers: The stories about the “fake snow” being passed around over the last week or so are based on a simple scientific phenomenon: sublimation.

Sublimation occurs when a solid skips the liquid phase and goes directly to gas, and when it comes to snow, the fire causes the frozen mass of snow to sublimate straight into water vapor, not liquid water.
As the flame is held up to the snow, some of the water retreats, or wicks, up into the remaining snow pack, increasing the water density of the remaining snow.
During this wicking process, some water may also be lost to evaporation (some suggest sublimation) against the heat of the flame.
The “soot” seen on the “fake snow” does not come from the snow, but the flame.

It is butane residue from the lighter which leaves the black deposit on the snow, as not 100% of the butane is burned, known as “incomplete combustion.” So contrary to some reports, the snow is not “fake” – it's just experiencing a normal reaction to heat.

question: why does the file size of digital photos vary when the pixel count doesn't change?
answers: The file size of digital photos can vary greatly even when the pixel count remains the same.

This is because the file size is not directly correlated to the pixel count, but instead is determined by a combination of factors, including the file format used to store the image, the amount of colour in the image, and the colour mode being used.
For instance, a JPEG image stored with a 96% Adobe 11 quality at a 18 Mp resolution can have a file size ranging from 4 Mb to 11 Mb, depending on the colour and brightness of the image.
Similarly, an uncompressed TIF image will always have the same file size for a given digital photo of a certain Mp resolution and colour mode.
Therefore, the file size of digital photos can vary significantly even when the pixel count remains the same.

question: after World War II, what changes did Germany make to it's own political system to ensure a dictator figure could never take power again?
answers: After World War II, Germany made several changes to its political system to ensure a dictator figure could never take power again.

The most significant of these was the adoption of the Grundgesetz or Basic Law in 1949, which established a federal state with three levels of government, and strict controls on state power through the separation of powers.
Furthermore, the Basic Law ensured that individuals were protected from discrimination based on race, origin, language or religion, and had the power to ban unconstitutional parties.
Additionally, the Basic Law established a 5-percent threshold, to ensure that only parties that could gain a certain amount of votes would be able to take seats in parliament.
Finally, the Federal Constitutional Court was set up to monitor power sharing, fundamental rights and democracy, with its main duty being judicial review - examining laws for their constitutionality.
These changes were so successful in preventing a dictator from ever seizing power in Germany again that other countries such as Spain have even adopted similar systems.

question: Why is it harder to fall asleep in noisy environments?
answers: It is harder to fall asleep in noisy environments because of the physiological effects of the noise.
People have an automatic "fight or flight" response to noise, which releases energizing stress hormones that prepare them to take emergency action.
This response occurs in a primitive part of the brain (the amygdala) and triggers stress hormone secretions even when a person is asleep.
This causes an increase in heart rate, blood pressure, and breathing, as well as more restless body movements.
Additionally, noise can make it more difficult to fall asleep in the first place by increasing the time it takes to fall asleep and making it harder to stay asleep during the night.
The average sound exposure level before a sleeping person will awaken is 55 dBA, though studies have shown that even levels as low as 40 dBA can cause physiological changes.
Therefore, it is important to try to keep things as quiet as possible for optimal sleep, either by using earplugs, a white noise machine, or playing low-volume classical music.

question: How do animals deal with getting prickles/thorns/splinters etc in their feet?
answers: Animals can deal with getting prickles, thorns, and splinters in their feet in several ways.

For thorns and splinters that are just beneath the skin, a needle can be used to carefully loosen the new layer of skin that has grown over the thorn or splinter and then the object can be removed with tweezers.
For thorns embedded in thick, calloused skin, a razor blade or nail clipper can be used to cut away the skin and remove the object.
For barbed thorns, like a fish hook, it is best to take the animal to a vet to have it removed.
The vet may need to sedate the animal and make a small incision to remove the thorn in its entirety.
To prevent infection, the area should be cleaned with warm, soapy water before and after the removal of the object.

question: How come some people have lovely handwriting and others don't?
answers: Some people have lovely handwriting and others don't because there are a variety of factors that influence the development of handwriting.

Handwriting is shaped by a person's life experiences, their character and how they were taught to write, as well as their anatomy, hand-eye coordination, muscle memory, and mental ability in copying proper penmanship.
However, genetics also play a role in shaping how a person writes, as bone structure affects how one holds a pen.
Additionally, people whose handwriting is extremely similar to their parents didn't inherit it, they simply copied it, maybe even subconsciously.
On the other hand, some people may have difficulty developing their handwriting due to a neurological disorder known as dysgraphia.
This disorder causes a person's writing to be distorted or incorrect, and usually emerges when a child is first introduced to writing.
Therefore, it is clear that the development of a person's handwriting is both a combination of nature and nurture and can be influenced by a variety of factors.

question: How were continents, countries and coastlines mapped out prior to the invention of satellites?
answers: Prior to the invention of satellites, continents, countries and coastlines were mapped out primarily through a combination of geodetic data and direct measurement methods.

Geodetic data involves measuring distances and angles in order to create a map, while direct measurement methods involve measuring the distances between different landmarks and points on the coastline.

On the coasts of seas, lakes and rivers, people would walk in fixed directions, counting their steps and noting the angular directions of every 100, 500, 1000 or more steps in order to draw an accurate coastline.
Additionally, people could map out large regions of land from the tops of mountains, as they could accurately note the distances between different landforms.
On the open sea, however, it was much more difficult to accurately estimate distances between different continents and archipelagos, as there were no discernible landforms to peg one's location to.
As such, determining the location of a ship on a latitude and longitude grid was the only reliable way to map out the open sea.
With the invention of satellites, however, mapping out continents, countries and coastlines became much easier, as high-altitude photographs could be taken from space.

question: Seismologists: How do you determine whether an earthquake was naturally occurring or if it was human induced?
answers: Seismologists use a variety of methods to determine whether an earthquake was naturally occurring or human induced.
One way is to measure the depth at which the earthquake occurred.
If it is at a depth greater than 10km, it is highly unlikely to be an artificial cause.
Another method is to compare the size of the different types of seismic waves generated by an earthquake.
Artificial explosions usually generate larger P waves than S waves, as well as proportionally smaller Surface waves than P waves.
By comparing these wave sizes, seismologists can get a better indication of the cause of the earthquake.
In the case of North Korean nuclear tests, the seismic waves generated by each test have a similar shape, differing only in magnitude, allowing seismologists to make a direct comparison.
Finally, seismologists can also use radionuclide monitoring or experiments at the test site itself to confirm whether an artificial explosion was nuclear in origin.

question: Why do we prefer cold pillows to warm pillows?
answers: We prefer cold pillows to warm pillows because our bodies need to drop around 1 to 2 degrees in temperature to drift off to sleep.

question: How does CRISPR work in a practical sense?
answers: CRISPR is a gene-editing technology that works by finding and replacing a specific sequence of DNA.
It typically uses a Cas9 enzyme to cut the DNA at the desired location, while also dragging along an RNA molecule to act as a guide.
This guide molecule helps the Cas9 enzyme identify the specific sequence, allowing the enzyme to make a precise cut.
After the cut is made, a molecule is used as a template to edit the DNA.
This can involve inserting new pieces, turning genes on or off, or editing a single letter of DNA without cutting the strand.
This technology is relatively cheap, fast, and adaptable, and can produce a finished mouse in just three weeks.

It has been used in a wide variety of animals, from early-branching metazoans to primates, and has been used in the agricultural and pharmaceutical industries to create products, as well as to understand the basis of diseases and test potential therapies.
CRISPR-Cas9 technology is a revolutionary gene-editing tool that is expected to have far-reaching advances in the future.

question: As a person with astigmatism, why is it when I squint my eyes a little I can see a little clearer?
answers: As a person with astigmatism, squinting can help you see a little clearer because it alters the shape of the space through which light passes.
Squinting helps to reduce the amount of light coming from other sources, which can help to reduce the noise that is obscuring your desired image.
The eyelids also serve to block out most of the light from other directions, which in turn helps to better focus the incoming light rays on the retina.
This results in a more precise focusing process, and a sharper and clearer image.
Additionally, the fovea, a tiny portion of the retina that is packed with cones, provides us with the ability to see things in greater detail.
By squinting, you are allowing the light to pass through the lens closer together and more accurately, which helps the eyes to focus the light rays better and allows you to see a clearer image.

question: Why can I eat mold on a cheese, but not on any other foods?
answers: Cheese is a unique food because some types are made with mold, a fungus that is normally best to avoid.
Blue and soft-ripened cheeses are grown with specific molds and are safe to eat, but if mold appears on soft, shredded, sliced, or crumbled varieties, they should be discarded immediately.
Hard cheeses, like cheddar, Parmesan, and Swiss, can be salvaged by cutting away the molded area.
This is because mold generally can’t penetrate far into hard and semi-soft cheeses.
It is important to cut off at least one inch around and below the moldy spot, and to keep the knife out of the mold to avoid contaminating other parts of the cheese.

Soft cheeses, such as cottage cheese, cream cheese, and ricotta, should be discarded if they have mold because the mold can spread throughout the cheese and cause contamination from harmful bacteria, such as listeria, brucella, salmonella, and E. coli.
Therefore, mold on cheese can be eaten, while mold on other foods should not be eaten.

question: Shutter Speed and Aperture.
answers: Shutter speed and aperture are two important components of photography.
The aperture is the part of the lens that controls how much light gets inside the camera, and it is measured in f stops.
A smaller f stop number means a wider aperture, allowing less light to enter the camera and creating a shallow depth of field where only a small part of the image is in focus.
This is a popular effect used by portrait photographers.
On the other hand, a narrower aperture will keep more of the image in focus.
The shutter speed determines how quickly or slowly the shutter closes when taking a picture.
A faster shutter speed will freeze motion and a slower shutter speed will blur motion.
This can be used to portray motion in a more artistic way.
Aperture also affects the exposure of the image, making them brighter or darker.
When used together, shutter speed and aperture can create stunning images that convey a certain mood or story.
Furthermore, the depth of field created by aperture can add an extra dimension to an image, making it more visually interesting.

question: What exactly is going on with my computer when it crashes?
answers: When your computer crashes, it means that a computer program or an operating system has stopped functioning properly, and this can be due to a software bug.

A software bug is typically caused by accessing invalid memory addresses, incorrect address values in the program counter, buffer overflow, overwriting a portion of the affected program code due to an earlier bug, executing invalid machine instructions (an illegal opcode), or triggering an unhandled exception.
In some cases, the crash can be so severe that it causes the entire system to crash or hang, often resulting in a kernel panic or fatal system error.
To determine the exact cause of the crash, it is necessary to debug the program and identify the original software bug that started the chain of events.

question: Dictionary tells me agnostic means "I think it can't be proven" but commonly in North America people seem to use it to mean "kinda don't believe in God". Why is that?
answers: It is true that the term “agnostic” is often used in North America to describe a person who “kinda doesn’t believe in God.” This use of the term is a result of a misunderstanding of what agnosticism actually is, as it is not an orientation between belief and non-belief in God.

Rather, agnosticism is an orientation that reflects a lack of knowledge concerning the existence of God, and an acceptance of the fact that there is no definitive way to know or prove whether or not God exists.
In essence, it is an acknowledgment that the question of God’s existence can never be fully answered one way or the other.
Agnosticism is not a belief system, nor is it a halfway point between theism and atheism.
Instead, it is an admission that the existence of God is a mystery, and that it’s impossible for humans to know for certain if God exists or not.
In North America, however, the term “agnostic” has come to be used as a label for people who are uncertain about their beliefs in God, and who are not actively professing either belief or non-belief.
This misunderstanding of the term has led many to view agnosticism as a “fence-sitting” position that exists between atheism and theism.
In reality, though, agnosticism is not an independent viewpoint – it is an answer to a different question than atheism is.

Atheism is an answer to “Do you believe any gods exist?” while agnosticism is an answer to “Do you know whether any gods exist?”   Therefore, it is possible to be both an atheist and an agnostic, as one does not have to assert absolute knowledge or proof of the nonexistence of God to be an atheist, and one does not have to believe or disbelieve in God to be an agnostic.

question: Why is it that a fully buffered YouTube video will buffer again from where you click on the progress bar when you skip a few seconds ahead?
answers: When you skip a few seconds ahead on a YouTube video, the video has to rebuffer because YouTube uses adaptive bitrate (ABR) algorithms to break videos into small chunks that load as you go.

The video player decides what quality the video can reasonably run without interruption, so if you try to skip ahead to a part of the video that hasn’t loaded yet, the buffering process is started again.
This is done to give users a more consistent viewing experience, and to save bandwidth, since most people don’t watch videos all the way through.
Unfortunately, this means that if you have a slow connection, videos in higher qualities such as 1080p may have some issues playing.
However, there are browser add-ons that can help with this.

question: What does "bit" mean, in reference to Encryption? i.e 4096-bit encrypted
answers: A bit is the smallest unit of information in computing and digital communications.
It is a single unit of information with two possible values; 0 or 1.
In terms of encryption, the bit refers to the length of the encryption or decryption key.
For example, a 4096-bit encryption key would take 2 4096 different combinations to break the encryption, which is virtually impossible for even the most powerful computers.
The strength of encryption increases with the number of bits, with the least protective being 40-bit encryption and the strongest being 256-bit encryption.
256-bit encryption is considered to be sufficient for users who want to perform optimum work over the internet.

question: What would happen to my body if I were trapped somewhere with a reliable water supply but no food
answers: If you were trapped somewhere with a reliable water supply but no food, your body would be able to survive for a few weeks.
Initially, your body would use its glucose reserves for energy, but within one day, these reserves would be depleted.
In order to meet its energy requirements, your body would then shift to breaking down fatty acids in your adipose (fatty) tissue, which would provide fuel to your muscles.
Eventually, the liver would begin producing ketone bodies, which would be released into the bloodstream and used by the brain for energy.
If this process of energy production continued without food, your body would eventually deplete its fatty acid reserves and begin breaking down protein from your muscles.
This would lead to a loss of heart, kidney and liver function and ultimately, death.

question: what do you do if you get pulled over?
answers: If you get pulled over, the first thing you should do is carefully pull over to a safe spot and turn off your engine.

It is important to show the police officer a few token courtesies such as rolling down your window all the way, putting out a cigarette, discarding any chewing gum and placing your hands on the steering wheel.
If it is dark outside, you should turn on your interior vehicle light.
You should stay in your vehicle and keep your hands visible until the officer directs you to get out.
Washington law requires drivers to show their license, registration and proof of insurance upon request from a police officer, so you should be prepared to do so.
It is important to be honest with the police and to ask for an explanation if something is unclear.
Accepting a citation is not an admission of guilt and you will have the opportunity to contest the citation in court after the fact.

question: Should the average person be concerned about the spread of Ebola as of right now?
answers: The average person should not be overly concerned about the spread of Ebola as of right now.
While the virus is highly infectious, its R0 (reproduction rate) is typically 1.5 to 2.0, which means that on average, each person with Ebola infects one other person.
Additionally, Ebola is not spread through the air, like the measles or flu, but requires close contact with some bodily fluid, such as blood or vomit, containing the virus.
This helps to keep its R0 low, and makes it easier to contain.
Furthermore, the current epidemic is mostly centered in West Africa, where conditions are less conducive to the rapid spread of the virus.

As long as more people become infected there, imported cases are more likely to appear in the U.S. and other parts of the world, but the risk of it spreading quickly is much lower in more developed nations.
So while it is important to remain vigilant and take the necessary precautions to prevent the spread of Ebola, the average person should not be overly concerned.

question: Will we ever know what happens when we die?

These experiences included feelings of peace, a perception of time dilation, and even memories of events related to their resuscitation.
While these experiences cannot be scientifically proven, they suggest that consciousness may continue after death, and that the mind may still be active even when the body is not.
While Parnia's research is promising, it is only the beginning of a long journey to understanding the nature of death.

Much more research is needed to fully understand the process, including further study into the experiences of those who have died, as well as investigations into the possibilities of life after death.

It may take years of further research to gain a better understanding of what happens to our minds when we die, but the current evidence does suggest that consciousness may be something that continues after death.

question: How does money go from my pocket, through the stock market, and to support the business I've bought stock from?
answers: When you buy stock, you are essentially purchasing a portion of a company.
Your money first goes to a broker, who then places a buy order on your behalf in the stock market.
The order is then sent to the stock exchange, where it is matched with a seller's order.
When the two orders are matched, your money is transferred to the seller.
The company then uses the money to invest in activities that will benefit the company, such as research and development, hiring of new employees, and expanding their product or service offerings.
The company can also use the money to pay dividends to its shareholders, which is where you can see a return on your investment.
Over time, if the company does well and its stock price increases, you can sell your stock for a profit.

question: Why doesn't it thunder during snow storms?
answers: Snow storms don't typically produce thunder because the cold winter air typically doesn’t contain a lot of moisture and so isn’t conducive to thunderstorms.
Air instability is important for thunderstorm formation and this commonly occurs when warm air near the surface of the Earth rises due to convection.
However, in winter, cold surface air temperatures and reduced sunlight mean there’s less surface heating and thus fewer opportunities for thunderstorms.

Additionally, even if the conditions were right for a thunderstorm to form, the cold air at the surface and the warm air above it act as a kind of insulating ceiling, preventing the sound waves from thunder from reaching the ground and creating the thunder sound.
This is why thunder during a thundersnow is usually muffled and sounds like a timpani drum rather than the loud cracking and booming of a summer thunderstorm.

question: if I need pain relief, how do I know whether to choose between aspirin, Tylenol, Advil, etc.? They are all labeled as pain relievers.
answers: Choosing between aspirin, Tylenol (acetaminophen), Advil (ibuprofen) and other pain relievers can be difficult, as they all have different properties and may be better suited for different types of pain.
Aspirin and ibuprofen are both NSAIDs (non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs) which work by inhibiting the body’s cyclooxygenase (COX) enzymes to reduce pain and swelling.
Acetaminophen, on the other hand, works in the heat center (hypothalamus) of the brain to reduce fever, and may also work on serotonin pathways in the central nervous system to reduce pain.
Therefore, if you are suffering from a fever, acetaminophen would be the better choice.
Ibuprofen is also more likely to be effective with inflammation-related pain, such as with sprains and strains.
Additionally, ibuprofen is metabolized by the kidneys, so it is not a great option for those with kidney issues.
Acetaminophen is metabolized by the liver, so it is not a great option for those with liver issues.

If you have neither kidney nor liver issues, it may be best to alternate between acetaminophen and ibuprofen to avoid overdosing as well as attacking pain and inflammation from two different approaches.
Ultimately, it is best to discuss all available options with your healthcare provider to determine which pain reliever is best suited for your individual needs.

question: How would a bank make money if I deposited 1 billion dollars into my savings, considering the interest would be millions?
answers: If you deposited 1 billion dollars into your savings account at a bank, the bank would be able to use all of that money to loan out, earning interest on the loans.
The bank would pay you a small amount of interest on your deposit, likely around 1.35%.
However, the interest they would receive from the loans they made with your money would be much higher.
For example, the interest rate on auto loans might be at least 5%, and mortgages and credit cards can have rates that reach into the double digits.
This difference between the amount of money the bank pays out in interest, and the amount it earns from loans, is how banks make money.
The bank would be able to keep the profits from the loans they made with your money, and you would receive a small interest rate for trusting the bank with your money.

question: How does evolution occur and how did the first living organisms come about
answers: The process of evolution is a complex one and the exact details of how the first living organisms came to be are still debated among scientists.

However, the primordial soup hypothesis, which was first proposed in the early 20th century, suggests that in Earth’s prebiotic history, simple organic matter was exposed to energy in the form of volcanoes and electrical storms.
This energy catalyzed chemical reactions that, in the span of a few hundred million years, could have produced self-replicating molecules.

This hypothesis has been supported by the findings of Charles Carter and Richard Wolfenden, who uncovered new evidence of abiogenesis, the process by which life arises from non-living chemical matter.
Their study suggests that a single ancient gene may have used each of its opposite DNA strands to code for different chemical catalysts, which then activated amino acids and formed proteins.
It is believed that these self-replicating molecules ultimately evolved into single-celled micro-organisms, or prokaryotes, which first appeared on Earth almost four billion years ago.

Over the span of a few hundred million years, natural selection pushed these single-celled organisms to evolve and adapt to the environment, eventually giving rise to the vast array of living organisms that exist today.
While much progress has been made in understanding this process, there is still no single definitive theory and much remains to be uncovered.

question: If I am not supposed to clean my ears deep with a q-tip, why does it feel so good and sometimes clear my sinuses?
answers: While it may feel good and sometimes clear your sinuses, you should not be cleaning your ears deep with a q-tip because it can cause dryness and minor trauma like abrasions.

Plus, your ears are self-cleaning organs, and the earwax that you're intent on digging out is an important part of that self-cleaning mechanism, as it has antibacterial properties to prevent ear infections and traps dirt, dust, and even insects.
Unfortunately, when you shove a q-tip in your ear, you're essentially just pushing the wax deeper in, where it can become impacted, painful, or lead to an ear infection.
Additionally, it can potentially rupture your eardrum or scratch the skin of the ear canal, which could lead to bleeding or infection.
Furthermore, the ear canal is only about an inch long from the external world to the drum, and the wax forms only at the outer edge.
The skin of the ear canal migrates outward like a conveyor belt and pushes the wax out, so by and large, ears are self-cleaning.
If you leave your ears alone, they'll leave you alone.
Thus, you should avoid cleaning your ears deep with a q-tip to prevent dryness, minor trauma, and potential infections.

question: Why are so many people choosing longboards over traditional skateboards these days? Are they easier to ride? What is the benefit?
answers: In recent years, more people have been choosing longboards over traditional skateboards due to their versatility and ease of use.
Longboards are typically longer and wider than skateboards, making them easier to balance and providing greater stability.
They also feature a flat design on their nose and tail, which makes them easier to turn and navigate.
Additionally, they come with thicker wheels that make it easier to ride and prevent tripping over the board.
Longboards are also great for beginners, as they are easier to get the hang of and can accommodate riders with larger feet.
In terms of tricks, longboards aren't as good as skateboards, but they are good for cruising and commuting, which is why many people prefer them.
Ultimately, the decision between a longboard and a traditional skateboard comes down to the rider's preference.

question: If most of what we taste is determined by smell, why do some things that smell good (cologne, perfume, soap, etc.) taste bad? (re-post/ rephrased from /r/explainlikeimfive)
answers: Most of what we taste is determined by smell, as our sense of taste is closely linked to our sense of smell.
This is why some things that smell good, such as cologne, perfume, and soap, can taste bad.
This is because our olfactory receptors, which are responsible for processing smells, can also detect the presence of certain compounds that have been linked to a soapy or unpleasant taste.
In the case of cilantro, this compound is an aldehyde.
Studies have found that people with a certain gene variant, called OR6A2, are more likely to detect the presence of this aldehyde and therefore have a more unpleasant reaction to cilantro.
Additionally, our taste preferences are also influenced by our environment and experiences.
For example, if someone is introduced to cilantro at an early age and associates it with enjoyable meals, they may be less likely to find cilantro to be unpleasant.
Ultimately, the combination of genetic predisposition and environmental influences can affect how we perceive the taste of certain foods and other substances.

question: Why are items always priced ending in ".99" instead of ".00"?
answers: Items are always priced ending in ".99" instead of ".00" due to psychological pricing, which is a type of marketing tactic that takes advantage of the way our brains process prices.

When we see a price of $9.99, we associate it as part of the $9–$9.99 “range” rather than the $10–$10.99 “range.” This is especially effective if you’re just quickly perusing several prices in a row; the first number will definitely stand out to you more.
Additionally, the .99 alone serves to make an item appear to be on sale, conditioning consumers to believe they are getting a good deal even if the markdown is minimal.

Furthermore, ending a price in .99 is based on the theory that, because we read from left to right, the first digit of the price resonates with us the most, so shoppers are more likely to buy a product for $4.99 than an identical one for $5.
Finally, when making product decisions, we tend to reduce the amount of effort expended, so we may not really process the numbers after the dollar amount.
